activity_b.text: Nimal works at a mechanical workshop in Kurunegala.
He starts work at eight o’clock every morning, but today he is starting earlier because a new batch of trainees is visiting the workshop.
He usually begins his day by cleaning the workbench, but this morning he is preparing the diagnostic scanner because the instructor is demonstrating how to check sensor readings.
He normally uses his own spanner set, but today he is sharing tools with his friend Amal because his toolbox is being repaired.
He always wears safety gloves and boots, but now he is wearing a heavier pair because he is handling sharp engine parts.
Most days, Nimal repairs motorcycles and changes oil filters, but this week he is tuning a small petrol engine from a three-wheeler for a customer who needs it urgently.
He usually checks the brake systems with the instructor, but today he is inspecting the cooling fan because it is making a strange noise.
He normally discusses the work with his classmates while working, but now he is listening carefully because the instructor is explaining how to test fuel injectors.
At the end of the day, Nimal always cleans his tools and locks his toolbox, but this afternoon he is cleaning the workshop floor because there has been an oil spill near the service bay.
He likes his training because he learns something new every day, and he is becoming more confident with every task he does.
